LIVESTOCK
Does your household keep any livestock?
Livestock - Goats
Consumption based coping strategies
Milk Production - 1
Milk Production - 2
Did you milk any animals in the last 4 weeks?
i) AVERAGE amount milked per day in 750ml bottles?
ii) AVERAGE amount consumed per day by the household in 750ml bottles?
iii) AVERAGE amount sold per day by the household in 750ml bottles?
iv) AVERAGE price of milk per 750ml bottle in (Ksh)
Who in the household consumed milk in the last 4 weeks?
3. STOCKS
3.1) Do you have food stocks (cereals and legumes)?
3.2) What are the sources?
3.3) How long is the stock expected to last? (Days)
During the last 7 days, were there days (and if so, how many) when your household had to use any of the following strategies to cope with lack of food or money to buy it?
1. Relied on less preferred and/or less expensive food
2. Borrowed food, or relied on help from friends or relatives
3. Reduced the number of meals eaten per day
4. Reduced the portion size of meals
5. Reduced the quantity of food consumed by adults/mothers to ensure that children had enough to eat
Livelihood based coping strategies
During the past 30 days, did anyone in your household have to engage in any following behaviours due to a lack of food or a lack of money to buy food?
1. Sold household assets/goods (radio, furniture, refrigerator, television, jewelry etc..)
2. Reduced non food expenses on health (including drugs) and education
3. Sold productive assets or means of transport (sewing machine, wheel barrow, bicycle, car, etc..)
4. Spent savings
5. Borrowed money / food from a formal lender / bank
6. Sold â€‹house or land
7. Withdrew children from school
8. Sold last female animals
9. Begging
10. Sold more animals (non productive) than usual
Nutrition and Household Food Consumption
How many days over the last 7 days, did members of your household eat the following food items, prepared and/or consumed at home , and what was their source?
Foods
1. Cereals and grain: Rice, Pasts, bread/cake and/or doughnuts, sorghum, millet, maize
2. Roots and Tubers: Potato, yam, cassava, white sweet potato, taro and /or other tubers
3. Pulses/nuts: Beans, cowpeas, peanuts, lentils, nut, soy, pigeon peas and/or other nuts
4. Orange vegetables (vegetables rich in vitamin A): Carrots, red peppers, pumpkin, orange sweet potato
5. Green leafy vegetables: Spinach, broccoli, amaranth, cassava leaves and/or other dark green leaves
6. Other vegetables: Onion, tomatoes, cucumber, radishes, green beans, peas, lettuce, etc.
7. Orange fruits (Fruits rich in vitamin A): Mango, papaya, apricot, peach tree, tomato
8. Other fruits: Banana, apple, lemon, tangerine
9. Meat: Goat, beef, chicken, pork, blood (meat in large quantities and not as a condiment)
10. Liver, kidney, heart and / or other organ meats
11. Fish / shellfish: Dried fish, canned tuna and/or other seafood (fish in large quantities and not as a condiment)
12. Eggs
13. Milk and other dairy products: Fresh milk/sour, yogurt, cheese, other dairy products (Exclude margarine/butter or small amounts of milk for tea / coffee)
14. Oil/fat/butter: Vegetable oil, palm oil, shea butter, margarine, other fats / oil
15. Sugar or sweet: Sugar, honey, jam, cakes, candy, cookies, pastries, sugary drinks
16. Condiments / spices: Tea, coffee, cocoa, salt, garlic, spices, yeast, baking powder, tomato sauce, meat or fish in very small quantities as condiments?
2. CROP PRODUCTION
2. CROP PRODUCTION - 1
2. CROP PRODUCTION - 2
2. CROP PRODUCTION - 3
Does the household grow any food crops?
i) Area harvested (in acres) in the last 4 weeks?
ii) How many (90Kg) bags did you harvest?
iii) How many (90Kg) bags did you sell?
iv) What was the average price per Kg?
